body_html: The problem is that get_attr on a type attr returns the enum value for that type, which happens to be 1 in this case. It would make vastly more sense if it returned a DType. Until we fix it, you can convert it to a DType via tf.as_dtype(ops[8].get_attr('T'))
body_text: The problem is that get_attr on a type attr returns the enum value for that type, which happens to be 1 in this case.  It would make vastly more sense if it returned a DType.  Until we fix it, you can convert it to a DType via tf.as_dtype(ops[8].get_attr('T'))
body: The problem is that `get_attr` on a type attr returns the enum value for that type, which happens to be 1 in this case.  It would make vastly more sense if it returned a `DType`.  Until we fix it, you can convert it to a `DType` via `tf.as_dtype(ops[8].get_attr('T'))`
